title: Recommendations Welcome
content:
I’m looking for some resources on type design. I’m a graphic designer mainly versed in layout, typesetting and identity design. Historically I’ve been using existing fonts from foundry’s but am becoming more interesting in design my own fonts. Can anyone recommend any good resources on the process of type design / type construction?

 [‹ Indesign CS2 UNderline/Strikethrough problems!!!](http://web.archive.org/web/20080209232308/http:/www.typophile.com/node/14623 "Go to previous forum topic") [Evert Bloemsma passed away over the weekend. ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080209232308/http:/www.typophile.com/node/10546 "Go to next forum topic")
author: aschibono

comments.content:

Specifically:  
 [http://www.typophile.com/node/7965](http://web.archive.org/web/20080209232308/http:/www.typophile.com/node/7965 "http://www.typophile.com/node/7965")  
 [http://www.typophile.com/node/13490](http://web.archive.org/web/20080209232308/http:/www.typophile.com/node/13490 "http://www.typophile.com/node/13490")

Is there a wiki entry for all of this stuff?

have a look around the [typowiki](http://web.archive.org/web/20080209232308/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/typowiki). In particular, check out the [How-To](http://web.archive.org/web/20080209232308/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/How-To), [Books](http://web.archive.org/web/20080209232308/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Books), [Software](http://web.archive.org/web/20080209232308/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Software), [Tools](http://web.archive.org/web/20080209232308/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Tools), and [FAQs](http://web.archive.org/web/20080209232308/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/FAQs) sections.
Very good. See I knew you’d have done that and I’ll I had to do was ask. :^D
